fields.description:
I setup a UFS Host and eucaconsole was installed.  I am able to login to the GUI, however, the counts on the dashboard tiles do not properly refresh.  They are continuously spinning.  I also see this in the eucaconsole.log:
{code}
2015-09-03 22:52:43 ERROR eucalyptus/admin@10.5.1.46 [GJ98hwFg04RAdxHA]: could not initialize proxy - no Session
{code}
I am unable to navigate to the Instances landing page as well.
This happens on HTTPS or HTTP logins and seems to only happen with the eucalyptus/admin account.  I have attached a screenshot to the bug.

I also see this in the cloud-error.log file:
{code}
Fri Sep 4 00:14:43 2015 ERROR [EuareService:Euare.08] [com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.listRoles(EuareService.java):1761] org.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: could not initialize proxy - no Session
org.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: could not initialize proxy - no Session
        at org.hibernate.proxy.AbstractLazyInitializer.initialize(AbstractLazyInitializer.java:164)

        at org.hibernate.proxy.pojo.javassist.JavassistLazyInitializer.invoke(JavassistLazyInitializer.java:185)

        at com.eucalyptus.auth.Accounts.getRoleArn(Accounts.java:384)
        at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.fillRoleResult(EuareService.java:2194)
        at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.listRoles(EuareService.java:1756)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor834.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.AbstractEntryPointResolver.invokeMethod(AbstractEntryPointResolver.java:151)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.ReflectionEntryPointResolver.invoke(ReflectionEntryPointResolver.java:121)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.invoke(DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.java:39)
        at org.mule.component.DefaultComponentLifecycleAdapter.invoke(DefaultComponentLifecycleAdapter.java:343)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractJavaComponent.invokeComponentInstance(AbstractJavaComponent.java:86)

        at org.mule.component.AbstractComponent$1$1.process(AbstractComponent.java:242)
        at org.mule.execution.ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.execute(ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.java:27)
        at org.mule.execution.MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.execute(MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.java:61)
        at org.mule.execution.MessageProcessorExecutionTemplate.execute(MessageProcessorExecutionTemplate.java:47)
        at org.mule.processor.chain.DefaultMessageProcessorChain.doProcess(DefaultMessageProcessorChain.java:95)
        at org.mule.processor.chain.AbstractMessageProcessorChain.process(AbstractMessageProcessorChain.java:70)

        at org.mule.component.AbstractComponent.process(AbstractComponent.java:160)
        at org.mule.service.processor.ServiceInternalMessageProcessor.process(ServiceInternalMessageProcessor.java:44)
        at org.mule.execution.ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.execute(ExceptionToMessagingExceptionExecutionInterceptor.java:27)
        at org.mule.execution.MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.execute(MessageProcessorNotificationExecutionInterceptor.java:61)

        at org.mule.execution.ResolvePreviousTransactionInterceptor.execute(ResolvePreviousTransactionInterceptor.java:48)
        at org.mule.execution.SuspendXaTransactionInterceptor.execute(SuspendXaTransactionInterceptor.java:54)
        at org.mule.execution.ValidateTransactionalStateInterceptor.execute(ValidateTransactionalStateInterceptor.java:44)

        at org.mule.execution.TransactionalErrorHandlingExecutionTemplate.execute(TransactionalErrorHandlingExecutionTemplate.java:34)
        at org.mule.processor.AsyncInterceptingMessageProcessor$AsyncMessageProcessorWorker.doRun(AsyncInterceptingMessageProcessor.java:184)
        at org.mule.work.AbstractMuleEventWork.run(AbstractMuleEventWork.java:43)
        at org.mule.work.WorkerContext.run(WorkerContext.java:311)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

I am currently using this eucaconsole version:
{code}
[root@c-04 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.2.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.7207.529.20150903gitb5bc6a2.el6   Build Date: Thu 03 Sep 2015 10:03:46 AM PDT
Install Date: Thu 03 Sep 2015 08:30:07 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-118
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.2.0-0.0.7207.529.20150903gitb5bc6a2.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 18800967                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}

Steps to reproduce:
# Setup a UFS host with eucaconsole installed
# Login to the UI with eucalyptus/admin credentials

Expected behavior: You should see the dashboard and tile counts.  You should be able to easily navigate to any tile link.
What actually happens: The tile counts never appear, their status is constantly spinning.  The  Instance landing page is inaccessible.
fields.summary: Tile counts spins continuously when using eucalyptus/admin account

comments.body: I just logged in using master on my laptop and the cloud was built early last week from packages. I saw normal behavior. Given the cloud-error exception, shouldn't this be a EUCA ticket?
I created EUCA-11336 for service issue.
[~dkavanagh]: I will assign this bug to me and verify it once [~sjones] fixes EUCA-11336.
I have retested this and the counts in the dashboard are updating as expected.
